lenders.loan_because: I can.  In the last year, I've had the opportunity to travel to various places in Southeast Asia.  I've seen so much beauty in all the countries I've been to but I've also seen so much poverty.  Its hard to just be a tourist and not make more of a difference to the people living there.  I ask myself...is there anything I can do besides being a tourist in these places?  Is there something I can do even if I only have little money to offer.  I'm hopeful that this is part of the answer :-)

lenders.name: Gar
lenders.loan_because: Luck played a large part in me being able to live as I do. Talent and ambition should be encouraged and nourished regardless of circumstance.

lenders.name: TheBikeLife
lenders.loan_because:
"We cannot change the cards we are dealt, just how we play the hand." - Randy Pausch...


Bettering the standard of living - especially in DVC's -  fundamentally rests on productivity gains via improvements to physical capital, better methodologies and technologies, or investments into human capital such as education.  Yet, it's often a catch-22 for those living in poverty:  To improve financial well-being one must make these investments, but to establish these investments one must have the financing.


While avoiding many of the debilitating complexities of foreign aid, Kiva establishes a market for microfinancing to prosper and provides the resources vital for rising out of dire poverty.  These loans create the opportunity for individuals to work hard and fund the investments they truly need for long-term gains - for their family, for their community, and for their country.  More often than not, they are good people that simply need an opportunity to thrive...

"We cannot change the cards we are dealt, just how we play the hand."  It only takes a little from us to greatly change these entrepreneurs' lives.  Let's step up and lend, and help them play the best hand of their lives!

lenders.loan_because: I am inspired by the stories and hard work of people all over the world trying to make a better life for their families.
lenders.occupational_info:

Twitter @jdbergeron

lenders.occupational_info: I work in educational video as well as making short films.  I am also a photographer, with a particular interest in live music photography.

lenders.name: InSite Yoga
lenders.loan_because: Our mission is to help individuals and communities progress toward the fullest expression of their potential. Lending through Kiva is one way in which can fulfill our purpose and extend our support to entrepreneurs and organizations around the world. It is also one of the ways we take our yoga practice 'off the mat and into the world'. So, in the spirit of generosity, compassion, and inner freedom we are thrilled to be a part of the Kiva community and give loans that change lives.
lenders.occupational_info: InSite Yoga is a mobile wellness company that develops educational programs and services that help individuals and communities access the well-documented benefits of yoga and progress toward the fullest expression of their potential.

lenders.name: Mark & Miya
lenders.loan_because: it helps to improve lives, and inspires others to do so also. This is a great place to start. Thanks goes to Kiva, and all within it for reaching out to those in need. The world needs viable, sustainable and equitable solutions to complex environmental and development challenges. Whether you work for a non-profit, in a business, in education, in law or become an entrepreneur, you can use your skills, knowledge and experience to build a better world. With such a perspective, we can create positive change in overseas communities where there are issues of economic inequality, social injustice, and environmental degradation. We can find out what we are passionate about and act on it in a way that is effective, sustainable, and responsible.
lenders.occupational_info: > MARK is a financial trader, and financial risk management consultant, assisting others to clarify, simplify and work with more focus in their trading. ...............................  > MIYA works in a community-based organization, helping poor children and their families to work to achieve transformational development. ..............................

lenders.name: Thierry
lenders.loan_because:
I wholeheartedly believe in the principles behind micro-finance and Kiva. 

People are fundamentally well intentioned and able. It's often the situation and context in which they live that impacts their ability to lead a fulfilling life and reach their dreams. Lending through Kiva, levels the playing field.

People get satisfaction in achieving their goals and meeting their own needs and Kiva certainly helps in that regard. But I also think Kiva helps the more fortunate ones among us get perspective and by making it easy for us to help out, makes us feel good too. 

I loan because helping someone in need makes me feel good.
lenders.occupational_info: I help people start companies and come-up with ways to sell their products.

lenders.name: Jeni
lenders.loan_because: I want to empower others

lenders.name: Paul
lenders.loan_because: I've been fortunate in my life, with others helping me in my studies and profession. I would like to return the favor to others.
lenders.occupational_info: I help children and grownups with worries that they don't understand and which make it difficult for them to enjoy their lives.

lenders.occupational_info: I help people get resources they need and encourage them to see their strengths so they can improve their lives.

lenders.name: Susan
lenders.loan_because: I love the idea of microfinance.  It is something that I can do to make my world a better place.  I believe I was very blessed to be born into the circumstances that I have and want to share them with others who are less fortunate.  When we enrich the lives of those around us or even across the globe the world becomes a better place, a place of love, a place of compassion, a place of hope, a place of positive energy and spirit.  It gives me great satisfaction to be a part of such an endeavor.
lenders.occupational_info: I recently graduated as a Family Nurse Practitioner after many years of struggle and work.  I understand how hard it is to come up with the money to accomplish a goal.  Where I live it is possible with hard work and determination to accomplish a goal.  I want to give others the opportunity to do that as well.  I love serving others and helping them to find peace in a world where little is offered elsewhere.  I treat their physical symptoms as well as their emotional, spiritual, and mental symptoms to help them to find this peace.  A smile and a word from someone who cares can make all the difference in someone's day.

lenders.name: Rob & Lisa
lenders.loan_because: We want to help.
lenders.occupational_info: We are currently college students, but we will be graduating soon.

lenders.name: Kim & Molly
lenders.loan_because: It's a great thing to do and so many need a helping hand.
lenders.occupational_info: We have a Christmas tree farm and a big garden that we grow many vegetables.

lenders.name: Rheana
lenders.loan_because: I believe in karma.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a first-year medical student. I look forward to living life as a physician and providing healthcare to people globally.

lenders.name: Georgiana
lenders.loan_because: I love all the great ideas people have to start wonderful new businesses and want to be a part of it!

lenders.name: IN MEMORY OF PER IMSLAND
lenders.occupation: IN MEMORY OF MY FATHER PER IMSLAND
lenders.loan_because:
IN MEMORY OF PER IMSLAND



This account is established in memory of my father, Per Imsland, born June 1931 and died April 2008 in Stavanger, Norway.

My father was born in Stavanger on June 12, 1931, the only child of Nacor and Aslaug Imsland. At an early age he began working in his father’s butcher shop, where he continued working during his Engineering studies at Kongsgaard College in Stavanger. Early on he showed his great entrepreneurship, and in the course of his life he helped start many businesses, and also had his own business. He married my mother, Haldis Espedal, in 1956. I was born in 1958 and my brother in 1963. He always encouraged my brother and me to do our best and see the opportunities that lay in front of us. Because of him and my mother, my brother and I have our own businesses today and are doing well because of what they taught us.

I want his spirit of giving and encouragement to go on living through this KIVA account, helping other people who are not as fortunate as us, making it possible for them to start and continue having a business that takes care of them and their families.

Sissel Imsland Bridges
Michigan, USA.
Sissely@aol.com

lenders.name: Bunny
lenders.loan_because: I respect the entrepreneurs who work so hard to make a living. A little of my money can make a much bigger difference in another country than it can where I live.

lenders.name: Kyle
lenders.loan_because: I heard about Kiva through Bill Clinton's book Giving: How Each of Us Can Change the World.
lenders.occupational_info: I work as a cell biologist at the University of Texas at Dallas, School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences.

lenders.name: Tanya
lenders.loan_because: now I can-- it's accessible, easy, and I can see how my  small loan (combined with others) are helping to change lives. Microlending is an amazing way to give the power and freedom back to people instead of initiating top-down oppressive approaches that leave the deicion-making to westerners.
lenders.occupational_info: I help working people achieve their dreams here in America. When people unite, they have power-- just like the microloans help a group of people achieve their dreams- the labor union helps working people receive a fair wage and the respect that each human deserves in the workplace.

lenders.name: Carol
lenders.loan_because: it's a great way to become a better steward of what God's given me, and a way to be a partner of what He is doing all over the world. Rather cool, don't you think?

lenders.name: Andy
lenders.loan_because: I feel guilty for having it so easy, and because I'm sorry for all the damage Americans have caused worldwide.
lenders.occupational_info: i try to live as simply as I can, scavenge and repair and recycle tools, machinery,etc.

lenders.name: Barbara
lenders.loan_because: I love to see how the money multiplies itself, so I can lend to more and more people...my original deposit has morphed into 10 times as much in loans over the years!  Now, THAT'S recycling... ;-)
lenders.occupational_info: A bit of a "mad scientist"...I make special custom medications "from scratch", in situations where mass-manufactured drugs are inappropriate (eg: making a heart medicine tablet into a flavored liquid for a baby, or making a medicine into a gel which can be rubbed on the skin instead of swallowed...).

lenders.name: Krish
lenders.loan_because: I want to remove the poverty wall one brick at a time.

lenders.loan_because: I would like to have a seed money to expand my NGO activities.This loan will be very help to launch our endevours towards the rural people of india
lenders.occupational_info: I am murugan,23, a graduate in engineering and social work,excutive member of  an NGO Regency for Innovative Social Change in India based at Dindigul,Tamilnadu,India and social innovator.

lenders.occupational_info: i make video games and it owns.

lenders.occupational_info: I am retired.  I travel to the Dominican Republic several times a year.  While there I volunteer in a school in a small village about 65 miles from the Haitian border.

lenders.loan_because: I am acutally living in San Jose and I am going back to China on a project to help chinese especially rural migrant workers to be able to have a little bit better life and possible help them to get access to information and get start in business such as a small photo shop,. a hand craft etc. I know reliable people but I don't have enough money to fund them.
lenders.occupational_info: I am China's CPA and US CPA candidate, before I left my job I work as Sarbanes Oxley consultant. So I  will be your ambassador to the poor place and validate the business plan for your money and your love for less fortunated people.

lenders.occupational_info: I am currently working on a new project after I spent almost 4 years working in commodities trading and recycling. This project is focused on promoting new clean tech in the metal scrap recycling, in order to reduce the environmental footprint of that type of recycling, while keeping a sound and improved business model.

lenders.loan_because: My friends Adam & Melissa gave me a Kiva gift certificate for my birthday-- what a great present! I hope to be able to pass the money back and forth around the world to help out some good people in need.

lenders.occupational_info: I use computers to create designs that will be printed or put on the web. I also make wedding movies for people using vintage super 8mm film and cameras.

Unfortunately this world is set up so that you need money to make more money.  People of any class can only have a certain amount of upward mobility that depends on the resources available to them. Also, Jesus probably likes it...

And you’re not just giving them money to get them through one more day. You’re helping them to help themselves to better lives. Repayment of the loans gives them the opportunity to become a part of the cycle of helping others.
